file_content.text: Thanks to you, I can prove Master Coops's indiscretions. Now Imperial Command will decide his fate.
I've given up on you finding the lost supplies that will prove Master Coops's impropriety. Good day to you.
You have returned. I find myself with bated breath.
Have you brought me the lost supplies that will allow me to incriminate Master Coops as a thief?
Take them. They were right where you said they'd be.
Yes. Here.
Today, you have honored the Empire. Master Coops will be exposed. His workers may suffer, but suffering is sometimes necessary.
I... admire you greatly. Please accept this small pittance of appreciation.
Much obliged.
It is I who am thankful. Indeed, most thankful.
This is what I work for.
I know in your heart that the credits pale in comparison to the pride you feel from stamping out impropriety.
You need to get a life.
You're creepy.
Why? My life is full. It's times like these that put a smile on my face.
Good day to you, fellow friend of the Empire.
I haven't been able to find them.
[Lie] Not yet.
Interesting. And disappointing. I hope you will not give up. I hope you will try again and deliver them to me shortly.
The lost supplies are scattered about the junkyards. I need them to incriminate Master Coops.
Interesting. Master Coops sent you, yes? Here to find his missing supplies. Interesting.
He said you have an idea where the supplies might be.
You are in the know.
I know exactly where they are. It's getting them that's the difficult part.
What's so interesting?
Explain yourself.
So very many things.
I don't have all day.
Hurry up.
My apologies. Unfortunately, my work cannot be rushed. It's painstaking and precise. I cannot cut corners.
First, I'm going to have to ask you to humor me for just a moment.
I need to know--do you have a previous relationship with Master Coops?
I'm not answering your questions, worm.
None of your business.
Interesting. That is, of course, your prerogative. I rescind the question and beg your forgiveness.
A Sith does not answer to the likes of you.
Swallow your questions.
I beg your forgiveness, my lord. I will not concern myself with the question any further.
I'm the one who asks the questions.
I won't be cross-examined.
My apologies, sir. I meant no disrespect. I believe you will understand my caution.
You need to know you're about to be incinerated.
I won't tolerate this.
My sincerest apologies, my lord. Please, I will not burden you with such inquiries any longer.
Never knew him before this.
We just met.
Interesting. I think I believe you. Now, you're loyal, yes? Just because Master Coops is paying you doesn't mean you'd undermine the Empire, correct?
Depends on how much he pays.
I'm not sure.
Coops and I go way back.
[Lie] We're old friends.
Interesting. And how fond are you of Master Coops? Would your relationship with him cause you to undermine the Empire?
What are you getting at?
Why?
My sense is I can trust you, so I'll be frank.
I'd never undermine the Empire.
Of course not.
Interesting. And good to hear. You are convincing, so I will enlist your assistance.
I suppose it would depend on the situation.
I'm not sure.
Interesting. And honest. I shall have to throw caution to the wind and hope you can be trusted.
It was I who exposed the former manager of Troida as a Republic agent. Now, I'm afraid it seems Master Coops may be up to no good.
What is he suspected of doing?
Tell me.
Surely not Master Coops.
You're a twit.
That is why I'm the right man for this job--I never let appearances deceive me.
We'll have to put a stop to that.
That can't be tolerated.
Interesting. My exact words. We think very much alike.
The supplies Master Coops has you retrieving were not from an Imperial shipment, but procured via smugglers and the black market.
It is admirable that he wishes to feed and protect his workers, but I believe he is skimming the till to pay for it. That is unacceptable.
What do you want from me?
Correct.
His heart is in the right place.
He means well.
Good intentions or not, he is still breaking the law, and I mean to expose it.
The shipment is the evidence. If I can secure it, I can prove his impropriety. But the area is just too dangerous for me.
The supplies were shot down in the junkyard. They are scattered about there. Please, bring them to me instead of Master Coops.
I'll think about it.
Maybe.
I hope that your sense of duty will sway your judgment.
You make a convincing argument.
Sounds like the right thing.
Of course. I stand on the side of right.
I'm in it for the credits.
Will you pay?
Interesting. I do not have much to fund this retrieval. The reward is knowing that the Empire has been served.
But if it is credits that speak to you, I'll find what I can.
The junkyards are a hazardous place. Be on guard. And I beseech you, bring the supplies to me, not to Master Coops.
I have much work to do here. Please leave the way you came.
Officially, I oversee the Troida warehouse and supply lines. In truth, I've been placed by Imperial Intelligence to sniff out impropriety and enemy sympathizers.
